page.title: 01Waternish, Isle of Skye
page.content: Waternish is a peninsula in the North-West of Skye. It is basically a crofting community. Most local inhabitants are part time crofters. There is insufficent arable land to justify full time crofting. Nowadays very few grain crops are grown. It is more ecconomical to buy supplies of animal feed during the Winter. Most householders do grow vegetables,mainly potatoes,for their own personal use. The land is more suited for hillfarming;namely sheep rather than cattle. Some is used by the Forestry Commission for growing trees. We have none of the facilities larger communities take for granted; shops,buses,banks. The land was originally part of Waternish Estate, which has gradually been sold off, piecemeal to land speculators.
